intro: Bakeridesia notolophium, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often upright and sturdy. Bakeridesia notolophium plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
